image.altText: Former premier Mike Ahern

items.synopsis: Federal Nationals Leader David Littleproud says the party has lost one of its greats with the death of reformist premier Mike Ahern. He is being remembered as a man of great integrity.

title.children: 'A good and decent man': Former Queensland premier Mike Ahern dead at 81

image.altText: A man sits on a rock

items.synopsis: A coroner has stopped parents of Luke Gilbert from giving their family impact statement after they refused to edit sections deemed "factually incorrect and offensive" by police.

title.children: Police shooting victim's swastika tattoos analysed as parents barred from making 'offensive' impact statement

image.altText: Sam Kerr stands on the sidelines with her arms folded during warm-ups for the Matildas' Women's World Cup clash with Denmark.

items.synopsis: Tony Gustavsson backs his captain and superstar striker to start on the field in the Matildas' Women's World Cup quarterfinal against France, but only if she is fit enough to play 90-plus minutes.

title.children: 'If Sam is fit to play 90 minutes, she is starting': Matildas coach unequivocal on Kerr's place for quarterfinal

image.altText: Four men in handcuffs stand with sheriff's officers outside a yellow brick building

items.synopsis: The underworld connections of one of the four men responsible for a fatal bashing in an Adelaide school car park three years ago can be revealed for the first time, after a South Australian judge allowed a suppression to be lifted.

title.children: School car park killer revealed as son of bikie executed on Gold Coast

image.altText: Michelle Bullock and Philip Lowe

items.synopsis: RBA governor Philip Lowe says inflation is falling and the worst is over for interest rate increases, but rising property prices are complicating things.

title.children: RBA governor Philip Lowe says 'the worst is over' for interest rate rises, as his term nears its end

image.altText: Tayla Cox wears pink and holds her baby girl Murphy

items.synopsis: The bodies of Tayla Cox and 11-week-old daughter Murphy were found by police on Thursday morning.

title.children: Queensland mother who was found dead at home with baby girl was a 'beacon of hope, joy and love'

image.altText: Pauline Hanson, dressed in a red jacket, wears a serious expression as she walks out of the Senate.

items.synopsis: A misleading viral video shared by One Nation leader Pauline Hanson and anti-Voice campaigners has sparked a wave of racial abuse towards an Aboriginal family and has left another couple feeling "crucified".

title.children: Families distressed after 'highly misleading' video used by anti-Voice campaigners goes viral

image.altText: The Bushwalkers artwork showing a group of people outside.

items.synopsis: Southern Highlands baker Tracy Nickl was clearing out artwork from his grandfather's home when he nearly gave one worth more than a million dollars to an op shop until his friend, artist Ben Quilty, saw it.

title.children: Million-dollar painting that nearly ended up in op shop now bound for National Gallery

image.altText: A man with a metal bucket.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Alex Agelopolous, 23, tell a Melbourne court he will plead guilty to storming AAMI Park with a large group of Melbourne Victory fans last December, an incident described by the magistrate as “a great day of shame” for Australian football.

title.children: 'A great day of shame': Melbourne Victory fans plead guilty over violent pitch invasion

image.altText: A curly-haired man wearing sunglasses and a mask.

items.synopsis: Justin Kane Millington repeatedly sexually assaulted one of his two victims, who told the court she could no longer imagine a life without constant fear, flashbacks and trauma.

title.children: Dating app rapist sentenced to eight years behind bars

image.altText: Victoria Cafasso's killer has never been found.

items.synopsis: Italian tourist Victoria Cafasso had been in Tasmania barely a week in 1995 when she was stabbed 17 times on an idyllic beach in broad daylight. Twenty-seven years on, police release new images and reveal they have conducted recent searches.

title.children: Police conducting new searches over grisly unsolved beach murder of Italian tourist Victoria Cafasso

image.altText: Sweden's Filippa Angeldal runs away from goal with outstretched arms after scoring in the Women's World Cup against Japan.

items.synopsis: Japan and Sweden meet in Auckland for the right to face Spain in the FIFA Women's World Cup semifinal after La Roja beat Netherlands 2-1 after extra time. Follow live.

title.children: Second-half penalty gives Sweden 2-0 lead in Women's World Cup quarterfinal against former champs Japan

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Filippa Angeldal makes no mistake! Look, Sweden's performance so far today is deserving of a second goal, but I still think that's a harsh penalty. It is the 150th goal at this World Cup so far. Japan makes a change as well, Minami Tanaka comes off, Riko Ueki comes on.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 51' SWEDEN SCORE!

children.content: Look, Sweden's performance so far today is deserving of a second goal, but I still think that's a harsh penalty.
It is the 150th goal at this World Cup so far.
Japan makes a change as well, Minami Tanaka comes off,

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What a half of football from Sweden. They have bullied and harried Japan at every possible opportunity here and take a deserved 1-0 lead into the half time break. The Swedish press is restricting any change Japan has to get a foothold in the match. Sweden would have not wanted half time to come there - they could have been two or three up in truth. Lots of work for Japan to do if they are to get back into this contest.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Half time: Japan 0-1 Sweden

children.content: What a half of football from Sweden.
They have bullied and harried Japan at every possible opportunity here and take a deserved 1-0 lead into the half time break.
The Swedish press is restricting any change Japan has to get a foothold in the match.
Sweden would have not wanted half time to come there - they could have been two or three up in truth.
Lots of work for Japan to do if they are to get back into this contest.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Amanda Ilestedt with her fourth goal of the tournament! Not bad for a central defender! Japan were simply unable to deal with a free kick that was played into the penalty area. Ayaka Yamashita came well to punch clear initially, but it was helped back in, Sweden seemed to have three or four little hooked attempts towards goal in the congested zone in the penalty area, but when the ball bounced free, Ilestedt ghosted in behind Saki Kumagai to rifle home into the top corner. Really interesting to see how Japan respond here.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 32' GOAL SWEDEN!

children.content: Amanda Ilestedt with her fourth goal of the tournament! Not bad for a central defender!
Japan were simply unable to deal with a free kick that was played into the penalty area.

Ayaka Yamashita came well to punch clear initially, but it was helped back in, Sweden seemed to have three or four little hooked attempts towards goal in the congested zone in the penalty area, but when the ball bounced free, Ilestedt ghosted in behind Saki Kumagai to rifle home into the top corner.
Really interesting to see how Japan respond here.

image.altText: a man stands next to a school bus

items.synopsis: The principal of an Alice Springs school whose students allegedly broke in and stole a bus says it is "another punch in the guts" as a local member says the children "rocked back up to school" the next day.

title.children: Tyre spikes used after eight students under 12 allegedly steal bus from Alice Springs school

image.altText: Ed Sheeran points at Michael Gudinski who hugs him and points a finger up. They wear matching black t shirts

items.synopsis: The star-studded Ego: The Michael Gudinski Story is loud, brash, and irreverent - just like the Mushroom mogul himself.

title.children: The Michael Gudinski doco is an irreverent portrait of the man who made the Australian music industry

image.altText: Three Brisbane Broncos NRL players embrace as they celebrate a try.

items.synopsis: The Broncos, Sea Eagles, Rabbitohs and Roosters will travel to Las Vegas next year, as the NRL looks to showcase rugby league to the massive US market.

title.children: NRL names clubs for historic Las Vegas double-header in 2024

image.altText: Felicity Fraser on a horse mid air over a jump

items.synopsis: After pleading guilty to several drug-related charges, Hunter Valley woman Felicity Fraser has been sentenced to nine-and-a-half years behind bars.

title.children: Jail for NSW horse racing identity over drug importation conspiracy

image.altText: A large, khaki-green military vehicle on treads, sits stationary on a slab of concrete. It is surrounded by machine parts.

items.synopsis: Wodonga resident Darrin Wright's dad found the Bren Gun Carrier in a paddock in the 1980s. Now it is mostly restored and its owners want to see it go to a good home.

title.children: Armoured carrier from WWII listed for sale on Facebook Marketplace

image.altText: Emma Walters appears serious as she walks out of the Melbourne Magistrates' Court.

items.synopsis: Emma Walters had been charged with plotting to kill her former partner John Setka, but police have now dropped those and other serious charges. She still faces other charges.

title.children: Police drop serious charges against Emma Walters, wife of union boss John Setka

image.altText: A sign indicating the way to the emergency apartment at a large, modern-looking hospital.

items.synopsis: A nurses' association says an ongoing failure to follow health procedures and policies at Townsville University Hospital has had disastrous consequences.

title.children: Nurses scared to work at Queensland hospital after deaths, sexual assault, association says

image.altText: Two women and a man wearing black flying suits hugging each other and smiling

items.synopsis: Virgin Galactic flew its commercial flight carrying tourists for the first time and reached 88 kilometres above Earth.

title.children: Caribbean mother-daughter duo and 80-year-old Olympian taken to the edge of space

image.altText: James Redmond Burrows outside a court.

items.synopsis: Tasmanian tax agent James Redmond Burrows was entrusted with very large sums of money by his clients but "deliberately and systematically betrayed that trust over a lengthy period", a court has heard.

title.children: Tax accountant who stole nearly $1.5m from clients and tax office to fund gambling addiction jailed

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a cap carrying an orange painting

items.synopsis: As Darwin launches one of Australia's biggest Indigenous art fairs, some artists fear allegations about interference in Indigenous paintings may have tarnished the industry's reputation and affected sales.

title.children: It's the biggest sales weekend for remote Aboriginal artists, but some fear their reputation has been tarnished

image.altText: Jacinta Price is on the left speaking in the red Senate chamber. On the right is Anthony Albanese speaking in the green house

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Shadow Minister for Indigenous Australians Jacinta Price have been arguing about the length of the Uluru Statement from the Heart. Who is correct?

title.children: CheckMate: Anthony Albanese says the Uluru Statement is one page, Jacinta Price says it's 26. Who is correct?

image.altText: An Asian woman standing behind a coffee machine.

items.synopsis: Cafes and restaurants saw a boom of big-spending customers after the pandemic. Now, as cost-of-living pressures bite households and the cost of doing business grows, some in the hospitality industry are struggling to stay afloat.

title.children: A perfect storm is brewing at Lillian's cafe: Rising costs and fewer customers coming through the door

image.altText: A burning building next to palm trees blowing in strong wind

items.synopsis: Experts say a combination of factors have led to wildfires in Hawaii claiming 55 lives, putting it in the top 10 deadliest fires in the 21st century globally and the worst in the island's history.

title.children: How a drought, a heatwave and a hurricane created Hawaii's deadliest wildfires ever

image.altText: Flames burn over the ridge of a hill at night.

items.synopsis: The Yankees Gap bushfire destroyed four homes and covered 20,000 hectares in southern NSW in 2018, with an inquiry this week hearing RFS crews attended a hazard reduction burn and left before it broke containment lines and spread on August 15.

title.children: RFS repeatedly attended hazard reduction burn before it led to Yankees Gap bushfire, coronial inquiry hears

image.altText: A side profile of a blonde woman with glasses and a black turtleneck

items.synopsis: Unanimous support for the Voice among major political parties in Western Australia comes to an end after a change in heart from WA Liberal Leader Libby Mettam.

title.children: WA Liberals Leader changes stance on Voice vote, blaming cultural heritage laws saga

image.altText: An island-like complex with red buildings and trees surrounded by water is seen from above, a white strip connecting to land

items.synopsis: The city of Bangkok is sinking, with coastal residents rebuilding their homes on stilts and erecting giant walls to protect sacred buildings from being swallowed by the sea.

title.children: 'This not fortune-telling, this is science': Climate change experts sound the alarm on the sinking city of Bangkok

image.altText: School bus windscreen smashed up near wipers

items.synopsis: An 18-year-old man is in custody and expected to face criminal charges after an alleged attack on a bus in the remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Man arrested after rock attack on school bus injures two schoolchildren

image.altText: A close up image of an engineered bacteria.

items.synopsis: The engineered bacteria called Acinetobacter baylyi has the ability to search through an environment, like the colon, and detect cancer DNA. Researchers say it could be used to screen for bowel cancer in a blood test.

title.children: Australian researchers engineer bacteria that could detect bowel cancer without stool test

image.altText: A husband and wife clutching a letter outside a home.

items.synopsis: Brisbane City Council says it's sorry for sending cryptic letters that led home owners to mistakenly believe their houses would be bulldozed to make way for parks.

title.children: Brisbane council apologises after 'ambiguous' letters leave home owners fearing they will be forced to sell

image.altText: Debbie Kilroy stands at the door of an office.

items.synopsis: Crusading lawyer Debbie Kilroy from Sisters Inside says it's "horrific" a woman on bail had to ask a Queensland court to send her back to jail, after she couldn't find suitable housing.

title.children: Prison 'the only place that can't say no' for women on bail without a home, advocate says

image.altText: A Pacific Islander worker picking raspberries.

items.synopsis: Changes to the Pacific Islander labour scheme mean workers must be guaranteed a minimum of 30 hours of work each week, but the horticulture industry says the seasonal nature of the work and weather events make that unworkable.

title.children: Growers warn 'unworkable' Pacific Islander worker changes lack critical flexibility required for horticulture
